title: Fix frontend build errors blocking successful deploy

requirements.summary: Resolve the frontend-side root cause of the current build/deploy failure with minimal, targeted changes while preserving existing routing and Internet Identity authentication behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean frontend build completes successfully without TypeScript or bundler errors.
The deployed app loads without a blank screen and core routes render (at minimum: / for unauthenticated users and /seller-dashboard after authentication).

No changes are made to any frontend immutable paths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Any user-facing text introduced or modified by the fix is in English.

file_operations.description: Fix the Principal import to match the projectâ€™s generated backend types (frontend/src/backend.d.ts) by switching away from '@dfinity/principal' to the Principal module used by the generated declarations, ensuring the build does not fail due to missing/incorrect Principal dependency or type mismatches.

Re-run TypeScript type-check reasoning within this file after the import fix to ensure all hooks that convert supplierId strings to Principal (e.g., useGetSupplier/useGetSupplierProducts) compile cleanly and remain behaviorally identical (no feature changes).
